<p style="font-size:22px; line-height: 2rem; background-color: #D9E3E8; margin-top:25px; margin-bottom:25px; padding: 20px; border-radius: 5px;">The Deportation Data Project collects and posts public, anonymized U.S. government immigration enforcement datasets. We use the Freedom of Information Act to gather datasets directly from the government, and we also post datasets that the government has posted proactively or in response to othersâ€™ requests. We expect these datasets to be used by journalists, researchers, lawyers, and policymakers.</p>

### Obtain data {.center}

We work to obtain immigration enforcement datasets from the U.S. government, primarily through the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA). 

[Explore requests](/foia.html){.btn-action-primary .btn-action .btn .btn-outline-primary .btn-lg role="button"} 

:::

::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-4 .g-col-lg-4}

### Post data

We share datasets that we have obtained, that the government posts proactively, and that others have shared with us.

[Download data](/data.html){.btn-action-primary .btn-action .btn .btn-outline-primary .btn-lg role="button"} 

:::

::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-4 .g-col-lg-4}

### Explain data

We document the data we post. We write detailed codebooks and post internal documentation from the agencies.

[Get started](/guide.html){.btn-action-primary .btn-action .btn .btn-outline-primary .btn-lg role="button"} 

:::
